review_title: The worst job I've ever had in my life.
pros: Honestly I cant think of any. I hated this job.
cons: Management was horrid. Ive never worked at such a awful place before. I wasnt ever given a schedule and was singled out to not be given a schedule by the store manager. She yelled at me on my first day after she put me on the frier with no training or help and accused me of hurting myself on purpose. I was given the worst tasks like cleaning poop out of the bathroom, or cleaning up gross messes. When I complained to corporate they gave me a lackluster response and didn't seem to care and my manager singled me out and chewed me out for going to corporate. The day I quit I had ice cream thrown at me by a aggressive customer and then got yelled at by my manager. I still consider working for McDonald's the worst job Ive ever had and Id never recommend a self respecting person to work for them.

review_title: I was dying there, quite literally
job_title: Crew Member in San Fernando, CA
pros: I was pretty much forced to go around and awkwardly ask phones to write a review for ourselves. Me being a writer I took the opportunity to make funny reviews. A rockstar, a hippie, a sassy mom, the possibilities are endless.
cons: Okay, you get hours but by hours I mean crazy hours. On a couple of occasions, I went home from work and slept for 4 hours got up, and went straight back to that god-forsaken hell. Why how could this happen. They don't follow the scheduling, which mind you is already terrible. You are not off on your scheduled time ur off when they tell you. They hold your meal break till the last possible second. And sometimes let you violate because to give someone else a meal because of how poor they keep track. If you inform on a doctor appointment or other occasion best believe you should just cancel cause if you say you need to be there at 3 in the afternoon, guess what you're of 10 minutes before 3 in the afternoon. My Orthodontist is a 2 hr job, excuse me. On another occasion, I need to go to the doctor and they held my break from me but decided to make me leave so late. I went in panic mode trying to get food before the doctor and was 30 minutes late. Not only that but they refuse to get the police involved during dangerous situations.

review_title: Couldn’t have felt more exploited in my entire life.
pros: Was fun hanging out with friends I guess. 30 minute breaks, free food.
cons: They payed me $11.50 an hour despite me being an adult who works full time with full availability, and at my location you’re supposed to be getting paid $15.00 for that. They never changed my income since I began there. Managers talk behind all the employees backs, absolutely nasty things. Genuinely disgusting to hear what they say on a daily basis. They do a very good job of pretending to be nice. Managers are very rude to every new person and it takes a few months before it feels like you’re not walking on eggshells around them. Pretty sure all those managers are 100% unaware that they regularly treat everyone around them in a disgusting manner, they make it seem like it’s normal for them. My coworkers sucked at training me. Every single person never failed to get extremely mad at you when you do something wrong on something you were never trained on. Got called retarded on a daily basis for mistakes they all make on an hourly basis, very toxic environment. I have autism so obviously this absolutely sucked being called that everyday that I worked there, but they never knew. The customers will absolutely drain the life out of you. You’ll learn that a lot of people don’t know basic life concepts and that you’ll still have to pretend like they’re correct. Many old people that come through don’t know how to do basic math, that’s a huge thing. You will get yelled at by these old people who suck at math, and nothing you will say or demonstrate will get through to them, so YOU have to act like the stupid one to get them the hell out of the drive through. Have fun being timed on everything. The whole idea of timing our orders is impressively stupid. About every other car is a family, and if it’s a mom ordering, usually takes at least 100 seconds. We’re told to keep it under 20. They completely ignore that a large portion of customers naturally take FOREVER to order, yet we still get punished. Very unfair. Wish I could list everything but I have to leave for an interview, so glad I quit McDonald’s. Never, EVER will I work a customer service position again. I regret ever working here.

review_title: Not best management or Anyone above them.
pros: First of all, management sucks at actually training their management team to train those new employees. They lack respect for their employees in general. If you work for a Paschen Management franchise then it’s worse. The General Managers play favorites and only give certain employees the best benefits just so they don’t leave or complain to corporate.
cons: No equality for everyone, including those in management.

pros:
Flexibility in schedule and shifts, great for who is studying or have other secondary responsibilities.
Easy to grow (crew trainer, manager, assistants) if you show interest
cons:
Working for a franchisee is totally different from working to McCop, the franchisees are too labour focused, meaning they cut the labour budget to maximize profit while McCop focus on other points as long as the restaurant is meeting other targets. The hard part is that the franchises, at least the one I work for, expect the restaurants to have the same standards and results as McCop restaurants sometimes with half the number of employees, so basically if a McCop restaurant wants something extra done they will give you the people to have it done while the franchisee will tell you that you have to manage to incorporate with the same staff number or lower.

And of course dealing with customers, for being a worldwided name and being 'accessessible' customers developed the feeling that they own the restaurant themselves and I see situations that I've never see in any other restaurant.

review_title: Honest Experience as a High School casual worker
pros:
- Meet some of the best human beings whether they are the people on your shift, or even the customers
- As an ex-employee, I miss the discounts lmao
- Learning to work under pressure efficiently 
- That feeling when a customer compliments your customer service 
- That other feeling when you served a customer after putting their order together under a minute CORRECTLY
- That other special feeling when you get paid on Tuesday evenings <3
- For my store specifically, shift management was done awesomely and shift swaps were also a plus <33
cons:
- Sometimes managers were hard to work with because they, and you could visibly see this lmao, prioritised or favoured other workers than yourself :) 
- Sometimes (this is rare for me so don't think this is an absolute recurrent thing) customers will get angry at you because they're impatient. If this does happen, don't stress too much because they will get over it after they're fed. You will be okay ! JUST ABSOLUTELY ALWAYS HAVE THE BEST MANNERS. ALWAYS BE POLITE. AND SYMPATHISE WITH YOUR CUSTOMERS ALWAYS IF THEIR ORDER IS TAKING A WHILE .... this makes them also understand that it isn't your fault and decreases the chance of items being thrown at you. (just kidding on that last part OR am I ?)
- Other members in the team might be mean or extremely bossy but just know ... it gets better & if its absolutely unbearable, you can request to have shifts with them not on :)

- Was my first job at 15, got to work with a bunch of other people my age
- Wasn't hard at all, just fast paced
- Taught me how to move extremely quickly yet accurately
- They're pretty much scouting who's gonna be the next set of managers all the time, you can totally move up within the store if you show that you have potential
- I made so much money as a teenager here, it's so easy to pick up shifts, if you need cash, you can make it here!
- There's so many people working that's I found it really easy to take days off when I needed to
cons:
- Got a couple gnarly burns at this job, just gotta be careful
- Some customers can really be jerks sometimes
- Overnights... Con for most people, but I enjoyed them
- I once sleep-took someones drive-thru order at my own bedroom window

pros: Honestly, it depends on which Mcdonalds you work at. I've had a great 2 year experience because of a team, but mostly the store manager, who actually cared and treated us like humans not machines. It's flexible work, specially great for students.
cons: Mcdonalds always had unrealistic standards from employees, but since the pandemic, they realised that one employee can do the work of 3, as the number of people was limited for a while, but now they use and abuse. Unfair pay for a multi billion dollar company, sick pay is mostly a myth, the uniform takes away any shred of personality that you might have, they won't allow you to have your phone on you, even if you're a parent that wants (and rightfully so) to check on your kids throughout the day. We're almost encouraged not to recycle, food waste is a massive issue, as well as cross-contamination, don't get me started on injuries (burns, cuts, etc). There are some amazing people working for Mcdonalds, but we're all treated like numbers and costumers treat us as if we're human garbage, there is barely any protection from rude, creepy, costumers.
